Sequence Information.Peptide Name: RANATUERIN-2Lb (Ranatuerin 2Lb, Also Ranatuerin-2PRd; natural AMPs; frog, amphibians, animals; XXU; 1S=S, UCSS1a; note: Ranatuerin-2PRe, MIC >50 uM)
Sequence Information.Source: North American frog,Rana luteiventris, ALSO: the Oregon spotted frogRana pretiosa

Literature Information.Literature: Chemical modification:  Disulfide bridge: C27,C32;Activity: strongly active against S. aureus (MIC 4 uM), E. coli (MIC 4 uM), and weakly C. albicans (MIC 62 uM).Discovery: Ranatuerin-2PRd found in the Oregon spotted frog shares the same sequence with this entry (Conlon JM et al 2011 Dev Comp Immunol Feb 1, 35:644â€“649). For other Ranatuerin-2PR peptides, see AP1716 and subsequent entries.Found in multiple species. Updated 3/2015; 7/2021/11/2023.
Literature Information.Author: Goraya J, Wang Y, Li Z, O'Flaherty M, Knoop FC, Platz JE, Conlon JM.2000
Literature Information.Title: Peptides with antimicrobial activity from four different families isolated from the skins of the North American frogs Rana luteiventris, Rana berlandieri and Rana pipiens.
